importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the Hamas-led attack in which Sergeant Major Tal Haimi was killed, marking the beginning of the conflict and the subsequent hostage crisis.
The signing date of the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire deal, which sets the framework for the return of hostages and is central to current diplomatic efforts.
The date of the identification and return of Sergeant Major Tal Haimi’s body, signaling progress in the implementation of the ceasefire agreement.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the ceasefire agreement is being implemented, including the transfer of deceased hostages, and the diplomatic push to ensure compliance.

keyTakeAways: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli military officer, was killed during the Hamas-led attack on October 7, 2023, while defending a kibbutz.
Haimi is the 13th deceased Israeli hostage identified since the US-proposed ceasefire deal was signed on October 9, 2025.
Haimi’s body was retrieved by the Red Cross in Gaza, transferred to Israeli forces, and identified by Israeli forensics examiners.
The ceasefire agreement requires Hamas to return all deceased hostages within 72 hours, but Israeli intelligence believes Hamas may not be able to recover all bodies due to war-related destruction.
One previously handed-over body was not an Israeli hostage, suggesting a possible misidentification rather than intentional error.
Hamas has stated that significant efforts and equipment are needed to recover bodies due to two years of war-related destruction in Gaza.
The US continues to pressure Hamas, with President Donald Trump threatening to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire.
US officials, including Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, held meetings with Israeli generals to discuss ceasefire compliance and implementation.
Israeli officials, including Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana, insist that the return of all deceased hostages must be fulfilled under the ceasefire agreement.
The Hostages and Missing Families Forum expressed condolences to Haimi’s family, recognizing the emotional significance of the identification and burial.

namedEntities.name: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A deceased Israeli military officer who was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the 13th identified deceased Israeli hostage transferred under the ceasefire agreement, making him a central figure in the ongoing humanitarian and diplomatic crisis.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian militant group that launched the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel and currently holds hostages.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is responsible for the initial attack, the current hostage situation, and the transfer of deceased bodies under the ceasefire agreement, which is central to the article's narrative.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The Israeli military responsible for defending the country and responding to attacks.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF confirmed Haimi's identity, called on Hamas to return all deceased hostages, and played a key role in receiving and processing the body from Gaza.

namedEntities.name: United States (US)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The nation that brokered a ceasefire deal with Hamas and continues to mediate between Israel and Hamas.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US proposed and continues to enforce the ceasefire agreement, with President Donald Trump and officials like Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner actively involved in negotiations.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The US President who threatened to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire agreement.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump’s public threats signal a strong US stance against Hamas non-compliance, adding political pressure to the ceasefire enforcement.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Trump’s special envoy who met with Israeli military officials to discuss ceasefire implementation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a key diplomatic figure involved in the ceasefire negotiations and ongoing efforts to enforce the agreement.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Trump’s son-in-law and a key figure in the US diplomatic efforts related to Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He participated in high-level meetings with Israeli military leadership to discuss ceasefire compliance and implementation.

namedEntities.name: Amir Ohana
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Knesset Speaker who emphasized the need to fulfill the ceasefire agreement, including the return of deceased hostages.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He represents the Israeli political leadership’s firm stance on upholding the ceasefire terms, especially regarding the return of hostages.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An international organization responsible for the retrieval and transfer of bodies in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross retrieved Haimi’s body from Gaza, playing a logistical role in the transfer process under the ceasefire framework.

namedEntities.name: Hostages and Missing Families Forum
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A group representing families of missing or deceased hostages.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The group expressed condolences to Haimi’s family, highlighting the emotional toll of the hostage crisis on civilians.

namedEntities.name: Thai national Sonthaya Oakkharasri
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The previous deceased hostage identified before Haimi’s body was returned.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Serves as context for the sequence of identifications under the ceasefire agreement, showing progress in the process.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israeli authorities have identified the body of deceased hostage Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, killed during the Hamas attack on October 7, 2023, as the 13th such body returned under the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire agreement. Haimi, a 41-year-old military officer, was found in Gaza and transferred through Red Cross channels to Israeli forces. His identification follows concerns over Hamas’s ability to recover all deceased hostages due to war damage and destruction. The article highlights ongoing diplomatic pressure from the United States, including threats from President Donald Trump to 'eradicate' Hamas for violations, and high-level meetings between US envoys and Israeli military leaders to enforce ceasefire terms. The event underscores the emotional and political gravity of the hostage crisis, with families receiving closure and political leaders pushing for compliance with the agreement.
title: Israel Identifies Body of Deceased Hostage as Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
